xmlns:bct="http://www.ibm.com/xmlns/prod/websphere/bpc-common/types/7.0" xmlns:htt="http://www.ibm.com/xmlns/prod/websphere/human-task/types/7.0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:import namespace="http://www.ibm.com/xmlns/prod/websphere/bpc-common/types/7.0" schemaLocation="../../../bpe/api/jaxws/BPCDataTypes.xsd"/> <!--TaskTemplates--> <xsd:element name="taskTemplates" type="htt:TaskTemplatesType"/> <xsd:complexType name="TaskTemplatesType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="taskTemplate" type="htt:TaskTemplateType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <!--TaskTemplate--> <xsd:element name="taskTemplate" type="htt:TaskTemplateType"/> <xsd:complexType name="TaskTemplateType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="tktid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The object identifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="name" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the task template.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="namespaceName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The namespace associated to the task template name and type properties.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="definitionName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the task template definition in the TEL.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="definitionNamespace" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The namespace of the task template definition in the TEL.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="validFromTime" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The time the task template became or becomes valid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="displayName" type="bct:LocalizedTextsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The display name of the task template.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="description" type="bct:LocalizedTextsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The description of the task template.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="applicationName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the application the task template is part of.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="applicationDefaultsID" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The ID of the application component that specifies the defaults for tasks derived from this template. Any property set explicitly on the task template or task overwrites the defaults provided by the application component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="kind" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The kind of tasks derived from this template. Possible values are: KIND_HUMAN, KIND_ORIGINATING, KIND_PARTICIPATING, KIND_ADMINISTRATIVE.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of the task template. A type can be used to categorize tasks derived from this template.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="state" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The state of the task template. Possible values are: STATE_STARTED or STATE_STOPPED.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="supportsAutomaticClaim" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether a task derived from this template is claimed automatically when it becomes ready. This requires that there is a single potential owner.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isBusinessRelevant" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether a task derived from this template is a business relevant or an "auxiliary" step. A business relevant step can, for example, be logged into the audit trail.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isAdHoc" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether the task template has been created ad-hoc. True states that the task template has been created ad-hoc. False states that the task template has been deployed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isInline" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether the task template describes an inline WPC_STAFF_ACTIVITY or not. True states that the task template describes an inline WPC_STAFF_ACTIVITY. False states that the task template does not describe an inline WPC_STAFF_ACTIVITY.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="containmentContextID" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The ID of the context the task template belongs to.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="durationUntilDeleted" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The duration until tasks derived from this template get deleted after reaching an end state. If not set, the task is deleted at once.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="durationUntilDue" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The duration until tasks derived from this template become due.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="priority" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The priority of tasks derived from this template. No special meaning is associated with this property. Escalations may, however, increase the priority of associated tasks.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="priorityDefinition" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The priority definition of tasks derived from this template.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="substitutionPolicy" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The substitution policy that takes place when staff assignments are performed for tasks derived from this task template. Possible values are: SUBSTITUTION_POLICY_SELECT_USER_IF_PRESENT, SUBSTITUTION_POLICY_SUBSTITUTE_IF_ABSENT, SUBSTITUTION_POLICY_NO_SUBSTITUTION</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="supportsDelegation" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether tasks derived from this template support delegation, for example, by transferring work items.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="supportsSubTasks" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether tasks derived from this template support creation of subtasks or follow-on tasks.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="supportsFollowOnTasks" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether the task supports the creation of follow-on tasks.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="supportsClaimIfSuspended" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether tasks derived from this template can be claimed even if they are suspended. True states that a task can be claimed if it is suspended. False states that a task cannot be claimed if it is suspended.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="contextAuthorizationOfOwner" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The authorization rights of owners of tasks that are derived from this template to the associated context. Possible values are: AUTH_NONE, AUTH_READER.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="eventHandlerName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the associated event handler.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="autoDeletionMode" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether an instance derived from the task template is automatically or conditionally deleted when it reaches an end execution state. End execution states are STATE_FINISHED, STATE_FAILED, STATE_TERMINATED, or STATE_EXPIRED. Note that task instances are actually deleted depending on the duration until deletion specification. Possible values are: AUTO_DELETE_ON_COMPLETION: States that a completed task instance derived from this template is deleted when the duration until deletion has passed. AUTO_DELETE_ON_SUCCESSFUL_COMPLETION: States that a task instance derived from this template is deleted when it reaches the FINISHED state. If the task instance completes successfully, then it is deleted when the duration until deletion has passed. If the task instance did not complete successfully, it it is not deleted regardless of the specification of the duration until deletion.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="assignmentType" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether tasks derived from this template can be assigned to a single person or to multiple persons in parallel. Possible assignment types are ASSIGNMENT_TYPE_SINGLE, ASSIGNMENT_TYPE_PARALLEL.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="autonomy" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States for standalone tasks whether an instance of the task template runs dependently of a potential parent or not. Returns either AUTONOMY_PEER or AUTONOMY_CHILD. For inline tasks, AUTONOMY_NOT_APPLICABLE is returned. Inline tasks are always dependent on their parents.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="durationUntilExpires" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Returns the duration when tasks derived from this template expire once they are activated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="inheritedAuthorization" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States for a subtask derived from this template which kind of authorization is inherited from parent tasks. Possible values are: STATE_INACTIVE, STATE_WAITING, STATE_ESCALATED, STATE_SUPERFLUOUS, STATE_SUBTASKS_COMPLETED.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="activationState" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The state of the task when this escalation was activated. Possible actions are: ACTION_CREATE_WORK_ITEM, ACTION_SEND_EMAIL, and ACTION_CREATE_EVENT.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="priorityIncrease" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether an escalation derived from this template increases the priority of associated tasks when they are escalated. Possible values are INCREASE_PRIORITY_NO, INCREASE_PRIORITY_ONCE, INCREASE_PRIORITY_REPEATED.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="escalationTime" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The time when the escalation will fire.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isDurationUntilEscalatedUpdateable" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Signals whether the duration until escalated property can be changed for the kind and current state of the object.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isDurationUntilRepeatedUpdateable" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Signals whether the duration until repeated property can be changed for the kind and current state of the object.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isEscalationTimeUpdateable" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Signals whether the escalation time property can be changed for the kind and current state of the object.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isNameUpdateable" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Signals whether the name property can be changed for the kind and current state of the object.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="endOfV7000" type="bct:SeparatorType"/> <xsd:any maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" namespace="##any" processContents="lax"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <!--HtmConfiguration--> <xsd:element name="htmConfiguration" type="htt:HtmConfigurationType"/> <xsd:complexType name="HtmConfigurationType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="isSubstitutionEnabled" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether substitution is enabled.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isSubstitutionManagementRestrictedToAdministrators" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether substitution settings can be changed by system administrators or by all users.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isGroupWorkItemsEnabled" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>States whether group work items can be used.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="endOfV7000" type="bct:SeparatorType"/> <xsd:any maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" namespace="##any" processContents="lax"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <!--UserSubstitutionDetail--> <xsd:element name="userSubstitutionDetail" type="htt:UserSubstitutionDetailType"/> <xsd:complexType name="UserSubstitutionDetailType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="substitutes" type="htt:SubstitutesType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>List of user IDs that have been set as substitutes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="startDate" type="xsd:date"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The start date for the user's absence interval.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="endDate" type="xsd:date"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The end date for the user's absence interval.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="endOfV7000" type="bct:SeparatorType"/> <xsd:any maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" namespace="##any"
